How had the Rio police grown by the 17th century?

answers.text: most captaincies already had local units with law enforcement functions

qas.question: When did Minas Gerais get a cavalry regiment?
Where did the Portuguese royal family move in 1808?
When did Rio get its first police inspector?

plausible_answers.text: most captaincies already had local units with law enforcement functions

qas.question: How had the Rio police grown by the 16th century?
When didn't Minas Gerais get a cavalry regiment?
Where did the Portuguese royal family move in 1880?

context: In <a0_0><b5_0>1566<b5_0/><a0_0/>, the first police investigator of Rio de Janeiro was recruited. By the 17th century, <a1_0><b6_0>most captaincies already had local units with law enforcement functions<b6_0/><a1_0/>. On <a2_0><b7_0>July 9, 1775<b7_0/><a2_0/> a Cavalry Regiment was created in the state of Minas Gerais for maintaining law and order. In 1808, the Portuguese royal family relocated to <a3_0><b8_0>Brazil<b8_0/><a3_0/>, because of the <a4_0><b9_0>French<b9_0/><a4_0/> invasion of Portugal. King João VI established the "Intendência Geral de Polícia" (General Police Intendancy) for investigations. He also created a Royal Police Guard for Rio de Janeiro in 1809. In 1831, after independence, each province started organizing its local "military police", with order maintenance tasks. The Federal Railroad Police was created in 1852.
